newsitem.title: FRANCE: MAS makes block booking on Air France freight.
newsitem.headline: MAS makes block booking on Air France freight.

text.p: Malaysian Air System (MAS) said it will take a weekly block booking on Air France's freighter service between Paris/Charles de Gaulle (CDG) and Kuala Lumpur.
"From June 1, we will have a 30-tonne allocation on one of Air France' Boeing 747-200F two weekly flights on the route," a Paris-based MAS cargo official told Reuters.

MAS' cargo capacity from Charles de Gaulle airport was reduced significantly last month when the Malaysian carrier withdrew Boeing 747 combis from its three-times weekly passenger Paris-Kuala Lumpur service replacing them with 747 all passenger aircraft.

To partially compensate for the combis' withdrawal from the route, MAS' Paris cargo station had increased its allocation of offline freighter and maindeck capacity offered jointly by the Malaysian carrier and KLM Royal Dutch Airlines NV KLM.AS from Schiphol, the official said.

"With the block booking on the Air France freighter and our offline options from Amsterdam, our Paris station will more or less have the same level of capacity as its disposal before the combis were withdrawn," he added
